Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 34th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1966...
Traded from Wisconsin to Pontiac on 3/2/1966 (Going to PON: LF W. Rutter. Going to WIS: P B. Cataldo)...
Injured on 7/6/1966 with a Bruised Hand, out for 3 days...
Injured on 6/3/1969 with a Scratched Cornea Eye, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/8/1973 with a Bruised Heel, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 4/6/1974, off Derek Perrin (WT)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/25/1974, off Willie Jones (LYN)...
Traded from Pontiac to Northeastern on 4/14/1976 (Going to PON: 3B W. Klimas. Going to NE: RF W. Rutter, P A. Clark)...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 4/1/1982...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/7/1982, hitting .450 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Boston (FBA) on 2/12/1983 to a 2-year deal worth $2,500,000 per year...
